title: Lost monitor causes "Object Not Found" exception
author: padillah
body_snippet:
Surface Pro X lost connection to monitor. When I regained connection the RDP window was truncated. I closed all tabs and tried to reconnect. Got the following exception:

```
Exception Message
"Object reference not set to an instance of an object."

Stack trace
   at WeifenLuo.WinFormsUI.Docking.DockPanel.OnLayout(LayoutEventArgs levent)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PerformLayout(LayoutEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PerformLayout()
   at System.Windows.Forms.C...

iterations.description: GetScreenById() accesses Screen.AllScreens[i] without bounds-checking after a monitor disconnect shrinks the array, causing IndexOutOfRangeException; fix is a one-line guard plus zeroing _sysMenSubItems in ResetScreenList().

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (claude): GetScreenById() accesses Screen.AllScreens[i] without bounds-checking after a monitor disconnect shrinks the array, causing IndexOutOfRangeException; fix is a one-line guard plus zeroing _sysMenSubItems in ResetScreenList().
Approach: In GetScreenById(), add 'if (i >= Screen.AllScreens.Length) continue;' before the return; in ResetScreenList(), call Array.Clear(_sysMenSubItems, 0, _sysMenSubItems.Length) to prevent stale slot matches.
